decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted  Development Order) 1995 or any Order revoking  and re-enacting that Order, no development within Part 1 (Classes A-H) [and Part 2 (Classes A-C)] of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be carried out without the grant of planning permission having first been obtained from the Council.

Reason: To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to prevent over development of the site by controlling proposed extensions and alterations
in order to ensure compliance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - A minimum of 252m2 internal ground floor floorspace within
    the proposed development shall be retained permanently for
    use as B1c (within the meaning of the Use Classes Order
    1987) and shall not be used for any other purpose within
    class B1.

Condition : 3 - No process  shall be carried on or machinery installed which is not such as could be carried on or installed in any residential area without detriment to the amenity of that area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke, soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 4 - No activity associated with the B1 use shall be carried out
    other than within the curtilage of the B1 buildings.

Condition : 5 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    residential units.

Condition : 6 - An acoustic survey of the proposed development site to
    determine the impact of the railway noise and vibration on
    the residential units shall be provided for consideration
    within the context of PPG24 by the Council prior to the
    commencement of the development.

Condition : 7 - Before the use commences sound insulation shall be provided
    for the residential buildings in accordance with a scheme to
    be submitted to and approved by the Council.

Condition : 8 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable
    room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall
    be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing
    ambient noise levels, expressed in DB(A) at such locations.
    Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in
    character the differences in these levels shall be at least
    10 dB(A).

Condition : 9 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details [by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development] [, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development], whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - The windows at first and second floor of residential units
    numbers 11,12, and 13 facing Rosemont Road shall be
    constructed in obscured glass and fixed permanently shut.

Condition : 12 - Prior to any works of demolition or implementation of
    development a 2.4m high barrier shall be erected 1m from the
    proposed building envelopes and the ground cover between the
    barrier and building envelopes covered to ensure its
    protection.  The barrier and ground cover will remain in
    place until the works are implementation are complete.

Condition : 13 - A scheme to ensure the protection of existing trees from
    works of excavation shall be submitted to and approved by
    the Council prior to the commencement of the development.
    This scheme shall involve:  details of the design of
    building foundations and layout, with dimensions and levels
    of service trenches and other excavations on site inso far
    as these items may affect trees on or adjoining the site.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that an equivalent ground floor internal
    floorspace is retained for use as B1c in the proposed
    development.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.
Condition : 17 - To protect the amenity of adjoining properties.

Condition : 18 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.
Condition : 19 - To protect the amenity of adjoining properties.

Condition : 20 - To enable the Council to be satisfied that the development
    accords with policy with respect to development adjacent to
    railway lines.
Condition : 21 - To protect the amenity of adjoining properties.

Condition : 22 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 23 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme.
Condition : 24 - To protect the amenity of occupants of 28 Rosemont Road.

Condition : 25 - To ensure that the remaining embarkment is adequately
    protect throughout works of demolition and development.

Condition : 26 - To ensure that the development is undertaken in accordance
    with a scheme to ensure the protection of existing trees.
description:
Variation of planning permission dated 20th April 1998 (ref.
PW9702272R3) for the redevelopment of the site for a mix of
900m2 of B1 floorspace, 19 residential houses and 8
residential flats (inclusive of 4 affordable flats) and
parking for 22 cars, development of a triangular site as a
community play area and landspace works to Rosemont
Embankment,
as shown on drawing numbers; 20D, /21D, /23E, /25C, /26B,
/27B, /28B, /31-43 (inclusive) 417/101.
